import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestClassifier
from sklearn.metrics import accuracy_score
from sklearn.impute import SimpleImputer
from sklearn.preprocessing import LabelEncoder
import warnings
warnings.filterwarnings('ignore')

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Separate features and target
X = train_df.drop(['PassengerId', 'Survived'], axis=1)
y = train_df['Survived']

# Handle missing values
X['Age'].fillna(X['Age'].median(), inplace=True)
X['Fare'].fillna(X['Fare'].median(), inplace=True)
X['Cabin'].fillna('Unknown', inplace=True)
X['Embarked'].fillna(X['Embarked'].mode()[0], inplace=True)

# Encode categorical variables
label_encoders = {}
categorical_columns = ['Sex', 'Embarked', 'Cabin']
for col in categorical_columns:
    le = LabelEncoder()
    X[col] = le.fit_transform(X[col].astype(str))
    label_encoders[col] = le

# Create dummy variables for Cabin (to handle multiple categories)
X = pd.get_dummies(X, columns=['Cabin'], prefix='Cabin', drop_first=True)

# Prepare test data
test_X = test_df.drop(['PassengerId'], axis=1)
test_X['Age'].fillna(test_X['Age'].median(), inplace=True)
test_X['Fare'].fillna(test_X['Fare'].median(), inplace=True)
test_X['Cabin'].fillna('Unknown', inplace=True)
test_X['Embarked'].fillna(test_X['Embarked'].mode()[0], inplace=True)

for col in categorical_columns:
    le = label_encoders[col]
    test_X[col] = le.transform(test_X[col].astype(str))

test_X = pd.get_dummies(test_X, columns=['Cabin'], prefix='Cabin', drop_first=True)

# Ensure columns are aligned
common_columns = X.columns.intersection(test_X.columns)
X = X[common_columns]
test_X = test_X[common_columns]

# Train model
model = RandomForestClassifier(n_estimators=100, random_state=42)
model.fit(X, y)

# Predict
predictions = model.predict(test_X)

# Create submission
submis

cat << 'ENDOFFILE' > train_and_predict.py
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestClassifier
from sklearn.metrics import accuracy_score
from sklearn.impute import SimpleImputer
from sklearn.preprocessing import LabelEncoder
import warnings
warnings.filterwarnings('ignore')

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Separate features and target
X = train_df.drop(['PassengerId', 'Survived'], axis=1)
y = train_df['Survived']

# Drop irrelevant columns: Name, Ticket (not useful), Cabin (too many missing)
X = X.drop(['Name', 'Ticket', 'Cabin'], axis=1)
test_X = test_df.drop(['PassengerId', 'Name', 'Ticket', 'Cabin'], axis=1)

# Handle missing values
X['Age'].fillna(X['Age'].median(), inplace=True)
X['Fare'].fillna(X['Fare'].median(), inplace=True)
test_X['Age'].fillna(test_X['Age'].median(), inplace=True)
test_X['Fare'].fillna(test_X['Fare'].median(), inplace=True)

# Encode categorical variables
label_encoders = {}
categorical_columns = ['Sex', 'Embarked']
for col in categorical_columns:
    le = LabelEncoder()
    X[col] = le.fit_transform(X[col].astype(str))
    label_encoders[col] = le

# Train model
model = RandomForestClassifier(n_estimators=100, random_state=42)
model.fit(X, y)

# Predict
predictions = model.predict(test_X)

# Create submission
submission = pd.DataFrame({
    'PassengerId': test_df['PassengerId'],
    'Survived': predictions
})

submission.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)
ENDOFFILE

cat << 'ENDOFFILE' > train_and_predict.py
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestClassifier
from sklearn.metrics import accuracy_score
from sklearn.impute import SimpleImputer
import warnings
warnings.filterwarnings('ignore')

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Separate features and target
X = train_df.drop(['PassengerId', 'Survived'], axis=1)
y = train_df['Survived']

# Drop irrelevant columns: Name, Ticket, Cabin
X = X.drop(['Name', 'Ticket', 'Cabin'], axis=1)
test_X = test_df.drop(['PassengerId', 'Name', 'Ticket', 'Cabin'], axis=1)

# Handle missing values
X['Age'].fillna(X['Age'].median(), inplace=True)
X['Fare'].fillna(X['Fare'].median(), inplace=True)
test_X['Age'].fillna(test_X['Age'].median(), inplace=True)
test_X['Fare'].fillna(test_X['Fare'].median(), inplace=True)

# Encode categorical variables
categorical_columns = ['Sex', 'Embarked']
for col in categorical_columns:
    # Convert to string and encode
    X[col] = X[col].astype(str)
    test_X[col] = test_X[col].astype(str)

# Train model
model = RandomForestClassifier(n_estimators=100, random_state=42)
model.fit(X, y)

# Predict
predictions = model.predict(test_X)

# Create submission
submission = pd.DataFrame({
    'PassengerId': test_df['PassengerId'],
    'Survived': predictions
})

submission.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)
ENDOFFILE

cat << 'ENDOFFILE' > train_and_predict.py
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np
from sklearn.ensemble import RandomForestClassifier
import warnings
warnings.filterwarnings('ignore')

# Load data
train_df = pd.read_csv('data/train.csv')
test_df = pd.read_csv('data/test.csv')

# Separate features and target
X = train_df.drop(['PassengerId', 'Survived'], axis=1)
y = train_df['Survived']

# Drop irrelevant columns: Name, Ticket, Cabin
X = X.drop(['Name', 'Ticket', 'Cabin'], axis=1)
test_X = test_df.drop(['PassengerId', 'Name', 'Ticket', 'Cabin'], axis=1)

# Handle missing values
X['Age'].fillna(X['Age'].median(), inplace=True)
X['Fare'].fillna(X['Fare'].median(), inplace=True)
test_X['Age'].fillna(test_X['Age'].median(), inplace=True)
test_X['Fare'].fillna(test_X['Fare'].median(), inplace=True)

# Convert categorical variables to dummy variables
X = pd.get_dummies(X, columns=['Sex', 'Embarked'], drop_first=True)
test_X = pd.get_dummies(test_X, columns=['Sex', 'Embarked'], drop_first=True)

# Ensure columns are aligned
common_columns = X.columns.intersection(test_X.columns)
X = X[common_columns]
test_X = test_X[common_columns]

# Train model
model = RandomForestClassifier(n_estimators=100, random_state=42)
model.fit(X, y)

# Predict
predictions = model.predict(test_X)

# Create submission
submission = pd.DataFrame({
    'PassengerId': test_df['PassengerId'],
    'Survived': predictions
})

submission.to_csv('submission.csv', index=False)
ENDOFFILE
